00037 // Encapsulates the details of grabbing the X server.
00038 // While a grab is effective, only our commands are processed.
00039 class MSGrabber: public QObject
00040 {
00041     Q_OBJECT
00042 
00043 public:
00044     MSGrabber();
00045 
00046     // grab() later when someone calls commit()
00047     void grabLater(bool setting = true);
00048 
00049     // grab() calls xlib immediately, but does not explicitly flush
00050     // the output queue.  Does nothing if the grab is already effective.
00051     // The grab is automatically released after a while unless reinforce()d.
00052     void grab();
00053     void reinforce();
00054     bool hasGrab() const { return has_grab; }
00055     bool grabDelayIsActive() const;
00056 
00057 public slots:
00058     void commit();
00059 
00060     // It is OK to ungrab() an ungrabbed server.
00061     void ungrab();
00062 
00063 protected:
00064     QTimer mercytimer;
00065 
00066 private:
00067     QElapsedTimer timeSinceLastUngrab;
00068     QTimer delayedGrabTimer;
00069     // @needs_grab tells whether commit() should grab or ungrab.
00070     // After commit() these state variables should be equal.
00071     bool needs_grab, has_grab;
00072 
00073     friend class ut_Anim;
00074 };
00075

00249     // "Print" @msg in xtrace, to show you where your program's control was
00250     // between the various X requests, responses and events.
00251     // Synopsis:
00252     // [1] MCompositeManager::xtrace();
00253     // [2] MCompositeManager::xtrace("HEI");
00254     // [3] MCompositeManager::xtrace(__PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "HEI");
00255     //
00256     // xtracef() is the same, except that it sends a formatted message.
00257     // You can leave @fun NULL if you want.
00258     static void xtrace (const char *fun = NULL, const char *msg = NULL,
00259                         int lmsg = -1);
00260     static void xtracef(const char *fun, const char *fmt, ...)
00261         __attribute__((format(printf, 2, 3)));
00262 #endif
